data.title: fix the layer touch recover,  using the Scene:
data.body: add layer XX into the scene. and setTouchEnabled false, then, remove XX from the scene,but not release. at last , add XX into scene again, it will setTouchEnable true. So, this is a bug, the layer add into scene again, the touch state need to same with  it onExit

[AUTO][ci skip]: updating cocos2dx_files.json
Android: Activity reopens after calling Director::getInstance()->end();
data.body:
On some devices, like Samsung Galaxy Note 4 when calling Director::getInstance()->end(); to exit game,
Activity will be recreated and game will be started again due to calling 

```
 android.os.Process.killProcess(android.os.Process.myPid());
```

This happens because system thinks that process was killed forcefully and tries to restore it back.

One solution could be to call Activity.finish(), and let the system take care of resources, or even System.exit(0);
I'm not sure about second one.

data.title: only updateTexture once

data.title: ScrollView优化处理:删除无用的日志输出;
data.body: scrollView的Children在可视区域时才显示.

data.title: [Spine] memory leak
data.body:
Engine Version: 3.6

To reproduce: create a spine animation, free textureCache from spine texture and make run another time the animation. This scenario is tipical for animation that required a big atlas. In a scene you show an animation, for memory reson you free textureCache but no memory will be free and the second time you run the animation another texture was loaded.

Motivation:
I notice that then used spine from js, but I'm sure the same problem is present also in c++ enviroment, texture of atlas cannot be released never.
This is due to initialize() method, where it is called and what it is do.

The void SkeletonRenderer::initXXXX method call initialize and the end where initXXX allocate _atlas and initialize put it at NULL.
